description: Base class for Drone modules

pub.name: status
pub.description: 0=disabled, 1=enabled, write a value of 2 or above to trigger reset

pub.name: name
pub.description: Module name

pub.name: resetCount
pub.description: Module reset count, e.g. for I2C errors

pub.name: type
pub.description: Module type name (class name)

pub.name: interval
pub.description: Number of milliseconds between updates

description: Manages a simple Depth sensor (sonar transducer) controlled via Trigger and Echo pins
guide:
Notes:
In the oceans the speed of sound varies between 1,450 and 1,570 metres per second or 0.145 cm per microsecond.
Given the transducer requires the sound pulse to travel to the bottom and back the effective distance per microsend is actually halved or 0.0725 cm per microsecond.
config:
// New Depth sensor bound to channel 30
Depth.new 30
  name "Depth"
  status true         // enabled
  interval 1000       // sample once per second
  pins OUT0_0 OUT0_1  // tigger and echo pins
  limits 0.25 10      // set sensor range to min=0.25m, max=10m
  speed 1480          // speed of sound in fresh water = 1480m/s
  $location [@>5.8]   // subscribe to GPS location
  distance 5          // publish log entires every 5m

  .publish "depth"    // publish the measured depth
  .publish "log"      // publish a combined log entry containing GPS location and depth

  // .publish "speed"
  // .publish "pins"
  // .publish "limits"
  // .publish "distance"
.done

pub.name: pins
pub.description: Pin connections for the depth module (Trigger, Echo)

pub.name: speed
pub.description: Set the speed of sound in water (default 1480 for fresh water)

pub.name: limits
pub.description: Min and max depth limits in meters (Default 0.25 10)

pub.name: depth
pub.description: Measured depth (or zero if unable to measure)

pub.name: log
pub.description: Composite log entry combining current GPS location and depth reading into a single param

pub.name: distance
pub.description: Minimum distance between log entires.  Will only publish a fresh log entry if more than distance from last sample location.  Default 0m.

description: Manages a Diagnostic 128x64 I2C display (1306 driver)

Diagnostic.new 6
  name "Diagnostic"

  bus 0
.done

description: Manages a HMC5883L I2C Compass
config:
[HMC5883L= 8]
  name= "Compass"
  interval= 100
  bus= 3
  status= 1
  calibX= -0.06, 2.88, 5.82
  calibY= -6.4, -3.48, -0.56
  trim= 0
  location= -1.8, 52, 100
  $location= @>7.8
  publish = heading, vector, calibX, calibY

pub.name: vector
pub.description: Raw magnetic field vector

pub.name: heading
pub.description: Heading adjusted for magnetic declination

pub.name: declination
pub.description: Current declination value

pub.name: calibX
pub.description: Min, center and max magnetic readings for the X axis

pub.name: calibY
pub.description: Min, center and max magnetic readings for the Y axis

pub.name: trim
pub.description: Manual calibration value to adjust heading to match hull (e.g. for a misaligned physical mount)

pub.name: limits
pub.description: Averaged limits at the four quadrants, used to refine the calibration onoine

pub.name: samples
pub.description: Number of calibration samples per quadrant

description: Provides overall system management and a pub/sub interface to the DroneModuleManager

pub.name: hostname
pub.description: Hostname of the device

pub.name: build
pub.description: Git commit hash at the time the firmware was built

pub.name: reset
pub.description: Set to 1 to trigger a reset

pub.name: heap
pub.description: Current size of heap (i.e. free memory)

pub.name: IP
pub.description: IP address

pub.name: uptime
pub.description: Uptime in seconds

pub.name: publishRate
pub.description: Rate of messages published per second

pub.name: choked
pub.description: Number of times a channel queue has choked (rejected a msg becuse full)

pub.name: discovery
pub.description: Enable/disable node discovery process.  Set to 1 to enable, or 0 to disable.

pub.name: macro
pub.description: Set to the path to a macro file (.txt file) to run the associated macro.  Note - the macro must be loaded first (e.g. via config.txt).

pub.name: wifi
pub.description: Enable/disable wifi. Set to 1 to enable, or 0 to disable.

pub.name: sleep
pub.description: How long to sleep in main loop - uses light sleep

pub.name: cpu
pub.description: CPU freq in MHz, valid values 240, 160, 80

description: Manages a Motor via an H Bridge module using PWM
config:
Motor.new 11
  name "LeftMotor"
  interval 50
  pins OUT0_0 OUT0_1 DAC0_0
  PWMChannel 15
  limits -0.7 0.7
  deadband 0.3
  $speed [@>10.8]

  // publish
  .publish "speed"
.done

pub.name: pins
pub.description: Pin connections - dependent on mode (e.g. A, B, EN for standard H-bridge)

pub.name: PWMChannel
pub.description: Which ESP32 PWM channel to use (default 15), mode 1 requires two channels and will use +1 as well

pub.name: limits
pub.description: Min and max speed limits in range -1 to 1 (default -1 1)

pub.name: deadband
pub.description: Input range within which to set the motor output to zero, interpreted abs(input).  Default 0.3

pub.name: mode
pub.description: Operational mode. 0: standard H-bridge with A, B, and PWM-EN. 1: BTS7960 with PWM F & R.  2: Cytron with PWM speed + Dir

pub.name: invert
pub.description: Invert output direction (0=normal, 1=inverted)

sub.name: speed
sub.description: Desired Motor speed in range -1 to 1

description: Manages a serial NMEA GPS device
config:
[NMEA= 7]
  name= "GPS"
  interval= 500
  port= 2
  baud= 9600
  publish =location, satellites, HDOP, followMe

pub.name: location
pub.description: Current GPS location

pub.name: satellites
pub.description: Number of satellites used for fix

pub.name: heading
pub.description: Current heading over ground

pub.name: speed
pub.description: Current speed over ground

pub.name: HDOP
pub.description: Current Horizontal Dilution of Precision

pub.name: port
pub.description: Which serial port to use (0,1 or 2)

pub.name: baud
pub.description: Baud rate to use, normally 9600

pub.name: fix
pub.description: Fix location - to use as basis for differential GPS signal

pub.name: followMe
pub.description: Location field with a small target radius

pub.name: packets
pub.description: Number of NMEA packets (sentences) received (valid, invalid, unknown)

sub.name: correction
sub.description: If fix location is set then this is the difference between live GPS and known location, for other nodes to subscribe to.  If no fix location, then this can be subbed to a base station correction param.

description: Managen navigation between waypoints accounting for crosswind drift
guide: Target waypoints are defined in terms of Lon Lat and target Radius in meters.
config:
[Nav= 9]
  name= "Nav"
  interval= 50
  crosswind = 0.2
  correction = 20
  $location= @>7.8
  target= -1.82, 51.56, 100
  publish = target, location, heading, distance, mode, last, home, crosstrack

sub.name: wind
sub.description: Current wind direction to allow for crosswind compensation

pub.name: heading
pub.description: Target heading to reach target, feed to Sailor.target or TurnRate.target

pub.name: distance
pub.description: Distance to target in meters

pub.name: mode
pub.description: 0=idle, 1=goto, 2=follow, 3=absolute course, 4=relative course, 5=backaway, 6=orbit

pub.name: last
pub.description: Location when we last received a new target, used to plan track

pub.name: home
pub.description: First valid location received since boot, used as home location

pub.name: crosstrack
pub.description: crosstrack ratio indicating distance from ideal track

pub.name: correction
pub.description: How much to adjust heading to stay on ideal track

pub.name: crosswind
pub.description: How much crosswind effect to account for - larger values cause heading to turn into the wind

pub.name: adjHeading
pub.description: Heading adjusted for crosswind, feed to Sailor.target or TurnRate.target

description: Base class for network interfaces

  port 2
  limits -10 10
  invert 0

  $right [@>10.9]

  // publish

  .publish "right"
.done

pub.name: limits
pub.description: Min and max speed limits in range -1 to 1 (default -1 1)

pub.name: port
pub.description: Serial port (0..2, default: 2)

pub.name: invert
pub.description: Invert axes (0 = normal, 1 = invert)

pub.name: invert
pub.description: Switch axes (0=normal, 1=switched i.e. switch left and right motors)

sub.name: left

sub.name: right

  name "PanTilt"
  PID (f) 0.005 0.0 0.0001
  interval 50
  $target [@>20.8]
  $heading [@>6.11]
  .publish "target"
  .publish "heading"
  .publish "PID"
  .publish "pan"
.done

pub.name: PID
pub.description: PID values (start with: 0.005 0.0 0.0001)

pub.name: limits
pub.description: Limits of servo travel in degrees (default -90 90)

pub.name: pan
pub.description: Pan output in range -1..1, to be fed to servo

description: Sail polar calibration module
guide:
Sail on a variety of headings relative to the wind, measuring speed over ground relative to wind speed and aggregating results to build a polar plot of saiiing performance vs heading.

When in passthrough mode, will simply pass the Sailor heading onto its output (module chaining). When active, will bypass the Sailor module and generate target headings.

In either mode, the Sailor module is left to generate the sheet command based on relative wind direction. This may need a separate calibration process.

Algorithm:

  • if outside the inner threshold - turn onto a heading that will orbit the target in a clockwise direction (configurable?) at distance of mid threshold, once speed over ground is over threshold, then select a new heading that goes from current location through the center of the target.
  • when crossing the inner threshold heading inward - record the start location and time.
  • when crossing the inner threshold heading outward - calculate effective heading and if close enough to target heading, then record the end location and time, compute the average speed and add to polar info.
  • if pass the outer threshold heading out, abort and switch to passthrough mode to allow nav/sailor modules to take over
  • if pass the outer threshold heading inward, switch to active mode
config:
[Polar=13]
  name="Polar"
  interval=1000
  $location=@>50.9
  $wind=@>50.10
  windSpeed =1
  $heading=@>Sailor.course
  target =-1.7454870, 51.5418469
  threshold =-1, 100
  radius =10, 20, 50
  mode= 1
  publish =l ocation, SOG, wind, windSpeed, heading, polar
  publish = adjHeading, mode, target, threshold, radius, samples

pub.name: target
pub.description: Lon/Lat of target

pub.name: mode
pub.description: Mode - passthrough (default), active, reset

pub.name: threshold
pub.description: Min SOG for tack and acceptable deviation from target heading

pub.name: polar
pub.description: Calculated polar plot

pub.name: samples
pub.description: Number of samples per polar bin

pub.name: radius
pub.description: Inner, mid and outer target radii

pub.name: adjHeading
pub.description: Adjusted heading - either passthrough of Heading or generated heading depending on mode

description: Manages DroneLink telemetry using an RFM69HW radio module
config:
[RFM69Telemetry=3]
  name= RFM69
  publish= RSSI,packets,speed,power

pub.name: RSSI
pub.description: RSSI of received packets

pub.name: packets
pub.description: Packet counters for sent, received and rejected

pub.name: speed
pub.description: Packet rates per second for sent, received and rejected

pub.name: power

description: Reads up to 4 PWM channels from an RC receiver
config:
Receiver.new 14
  name "Receiver"
  interval 200
  pins 34
  limits 980 2020
  mode 1 // PPM
  $switch [@>14.13]
  $input1 [@>9.14]
  $input2 [@>8.16]
  //.publish "pins"
  .publish "value1"
  .publish "value2"
  .publish "value3"
  .publish "input"
  .publish "limits"
  .publish "input1"
  .publish "input2"
  .publish "switch"
.done
guide:
PWM values from an RC receiver are decoded using interrupt routines, then converted and published as values (value1, value2, etc) in range -1..1 on a regular interval. Output values can be subscribed to from other modules (e.g. Servo or TankSteer). Up to 4 channels can be read.

The valid range of PWM input values (i.e. pulse timings in ms) are defined by the limits parameter.

Deadman protection is triggered after 5 seconds of no valid PWM signals and all output values are set to zero.

The module can optionally be chained behind other modules (e.g. for automated navigation) with a virtual switch to flip outputs between channel subscriptions (passthrough mode) vs RC receiver inputs. The switch parameter controls which mode the module is in - if switch is less than 0.5 then it is in passthrough (subscription values are output), otherwise in active mode (i.e. RC receiver values are output).

pub.name: pins
pub.description: Receiver input pins, one per receiver channel (see Pin Mappings) or a single pin for PPM

pub.name: value1
pub.description: The output value on channel 1 (in range -1 .. 1)

pub.name: value2
pub.description: The output value on channel 2 (in range -1 .. 1)

pub.name: value3
pub.description: The output value on channel 3 (in range -1 .. 1)

pub.name: value3
pub.description: The output value on channel 4 (in range -1 .. 1)

pub.name: limits
pub.description: The PWM timing min and max limits (default 1000 .. 2000)

pub.name: input
pub.description: Raw PWM timing input values for each channel

pub.name: mode
pub.description: 0=PWM, 1=PPM on first defined pin (Default PPM)

sub.name: input1
sub.description: Subscription for channel 1 (used in passthrough mode)

sub.name: input2
sub.description: Subscription for channel 2 (used in passthrough mode)

sub.name: input3
sub.description: Subscription for channel 3 (used in passthrough mode)

sub.name: input4
sub.description: Subscription for channel 4 (used in passthrough mode)

sub.name: switch
sub.description: Mode control value - passthrough if less than 0.5, otherwise active (defaults to active)

description: Control a typical sailing boat
guide:
Sailor controller

subs
* target heading (from nav module)
* wind direction (from wind sensor)
* cross-track factor (from nav module)
* ocean current vector - TODO

pubs
* heading (course to sail) - fed to rudder
* sheet extension (from 0 - close haul to 1 - run) - fed to sheet actuator

config (pubs)
* polar - sailing performance for different headings relative to wind
   - modelled as 16 segments in the clockwise 180 degree region (assumes mirrored performance)
   - each segment is 180/16 degree = 11.25 degree arc, centre of segment should be considered the target heading to achieve associated performance
   - performance stored as a single uint8_t value = 0..255
config:
[Sailor=12]
  name="Sailor"
  interval=1000
  polar=0, 0, 0, 200,   255, 255, 255, 250,  240, 230, 220, 210,  200, 180, 160, 140
  crosswind=0.5
  $wind=@>50.10
  $target=@>Nav.heading
  $heading=@>50.8
  $crosstrack=@>Nav.crosstrack
  publish=target, heading, wind, crosstrack, course, sheet, polar

pub.name: course
pub.description: Selected course/bearing - feed to Turnrate

pub.name: sheet
pub.description: Sheet servo control value in range -1 (close haul) to 1 (run)

pub.name: polar
pub.description: Polar map for starboard wind (0-180 degrees), mirrored for port.  0=stall, 255=max relative speed

pub.name: speed
pub.description: polar plot of estimated speeds by heading - 0-180

pub.name: speed2
pub.description: polar plot of estimated speeds by heading - 180-360

pub.name: flags
pub.description: [0] = onStarboardTack,  [1] = tackLocked,  [2] = lastCrossTrackPositive

pub.name: wing
pub.description: Wingsail flap position.. 1 = starboard wind, -1 = port wind

pub.name: packets

pub.name: speed

pub.name: baud

  centre= 8

  interval= 100

pub.name: pins

pub.name: limits

pub.name: map
pub.description: Bezier curve control points to map input (-1..1) to output (0..180)

pub.name: centre
pub.description: Centre adjustment, applied after map

pub.name: output
pub.description: The raw angle sent to the Servo PWM controller (0..180)

guide:
<li> Sub to distance (from Nav)
   <li> Param for speed limits

   <li> Generate speed output to feed TankSteer, etc

description: Monitors up to four parameters and publishes a corresponding status scene to a Neopixel module

pub.name: scene
pub.description: Status scene for a Neopixel module to subscribe to.  Set an initial value for scene to configure brightness, etc

pub.name: value1
pub.description: Threshold for sub1

pub.name: value2
pub.description: Threshold for sub2

pub.name: value3
pub.description: Threshold for sub3

pub.name: value4
pub.description: Threshold for sub4

sub.name: sub1
sub.description: First parameter to monitor for status

sub.name: sub2
sub.description: First parameter to monitor for status

sub.name: sub3
sub.description: First parameter to monitor for status

sub.name: sub4
sub.description: First parameter to monitor for status

description: Generate left and right motor speeds from speed and turnRate inputs
guide:
Tank steering:
   * Sub to target heading
   * Sub to current heading
   * Sub to distance
   * Generate left and right motor speed values
config:
TankSteer.new 10
  name "TankSteer"
  interval 50
  trim 0
  $speed [@>9.14]
  $turnRate [@>8.16]
  .publish "left"
  .publish "right"
  .publish "turnRate"
  .publish "speed"
  .publish "trim"
.done

pub.name: left
pub.description: Left motor speed output in range -1..1

pub.name: right
pub.description: Right motor speed output in range -1..1

pub.name: mode
pub.description: 1=Automated (responds to speed and turnRate subs) or 0=Manual (ignores subs, but speed and turnRate values can be directly written to)

sub.name: turnRate
sub.description: Rate of turn in range -1..1 where positive values are clockwise

description: Emits a configured message on a set interval (WIP)
Generate a turnRate command based on target vs current heading using a PID controller
guide:
Steering commands are based on:

  • Sub to target heading
  • Sub to current heading
  • Tuning parameters (PID)
  • Generate turn rate

Gybe control

If heading error stays large (and same sign) for extended period, then attempt to gybe (i.e. go the longer way round the circle), until the sign of the error changes.

Control parameters are:

  • Error threshold to trigger the gybe timer (e.g. 30 degrees)
  • Timeout duration (e.g. 10 seconds) after which to initiate the gybe
config:
[TurnRate=8]
  name=TurnRate
  PID=0.005, 0.0, 0.0001
  interval=50
  threshold=30
  timeout=25
  $target=@>Polar.adjHeading
  $heading=@>50.8
  publish=target, heading, PID, turnRate, mode

pub.name: turnRate
pub.description: turnRate output in range -1..1, where 1 is clockwise

pub.name: threshold
pub.description: Error threshold to trigger the gybe timer (default 20 degrees)

pub.name: timeout
pub.description: Timeout duration in seconds after which to initiate the gybe (default 10s)

pub.name: mode
pub.description: Mode (0=normal, 1=potential gybe, 2=gybe)

description: Manages a Wind speed and direction sensor.
guide:
- Wind direction using I2C AS5600 sensor
- Wind speed from cup anemometor on an digital input with internal pullup
config:
[Wind= 14]
  name= "Wind"
  interval= 100
  bus= 4
  $heading= @>8.11
  centre= -10
  publish= heading, direction, centre, wind

pub.name: direction
pub.description: local wind direction

pub.name: speed
pub.description: wind speed

pub.name: pins
pub.description: Pin to use for anemometer interrupt signal

pub.name: centre
pub.description: Calibration for local wind direction

pub.name: wind
pub.description: World wind direction - combination of local direction and heading

pub.name: mode
pub.description: Operation mode 0=standard, 1=inverted (upside down, e.g. for water direction sensor), 2=anemometer

sub.name: heading
sub.description: Sub to compass heading to work out world wind direction
